intro: Neoevansia zopilotensis, commonly known as the Zopilotensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
